Reviews.Title: “Recommended...will book again.”
Reviews.Author: 558Mazz
Reviews.Content: Lovely little hotel, with cosy rooms suitable for couples, like ourselves, on a short trip to Paris. Located in a scenic neighbourhood, the views from our fourth floor room were charming, overlooking a bustling playground and a bustling little street that was filled with character. The hotel is superbly located within yards of the local metro and we found it easy to access most of the major attractions from our base. Around the corner from the hotel are a number of cafes, one of which serves a delicious breakfast for 9 euro, and we often took a metro just two stops to Montemartre, where there are lots of affordable restaurants, for an evening meal. The staff at the hotel were a pleasure to deal with and were most helpful. The only small criticism I would make is that it appeared that our bath was not cleaned during our four night stay, but in all other respects the cleanliness was more than satisfactory. We will be booking for a return visit in the future and would recommend the hotel to anyone who wants a great French experience on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and cosy, very long check-in”
Reviews.Author: Hikingirl
Reviews.Content: The location is central, close to St Georges station, very convenient ! This area is a very pleasant place. I stayed three times in this hotel. First time, the check-in lasted 25 min. Nobody at the reception on my arrival, then a booking problem to solve with the previous customer. And the receptionist didn't speak english fluently. Second time, normal check-in. Third time, I had to wait 1 hour to get my room whereas it was 2:00 pm. The courtyard room was quiet, cosy and equipped with a safe. The bathroom was very clean. The decoration and lighting create a cosy atmosphere. The breakfast price is indecent. So like several customers, I had breakfast in a bar, place St Georges, 50m from the hotel entrance. Last time I stayed in this hotel, the fire alarm rang at 2:45 am. Lots of customers went down quickly to the reception. The receptionist stayed silently behind his desk as if nothing was happening. He waited to be questioned about the fire alarm to reply ‘it’s nothing’, without any explanation. It was not reassuring at all. When I went up to my room, the alarm was still ringing. In this kind of situation, I expect information from the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel”
Reviews.Author: eringi
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 days with my family. The room is comfortable and cute decorated. I had breakfast each morning during stay, it was delicious and fulled. I think it is a bit far from the center of Paris, but there are some shops and cafes around hotel so I didn't think it is uncomfortable. We had great time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: gizmo_222
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night. Very good location, a few steps from the metro. Good location for shopping (La Fayette shopping district and Opera). Also, lots of restaurants and bars in the area. Very satisfied that I choose this place.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Azriel_11
Reviews.Content: Me and my friends were pleasantly surprised upon arrival at the hotel. The hotel was more than we expected. Great location, steps away from Montmartre and the Moulin R. We had two rooms on the first floor and both were surprisingly spacious for Paris standards. You might here noise coming from metro, but it didn't bother us. Metro station is just next to the hotel. Friendly reception staff and good breakfast. There are some good restaurants near the hotel, but our favorite one was "La serenissima" (try tagliatelle con scampi). We went to a show Crazy Horse, and now we think that Moulin Rouge might be a better choice if you are in doubt. Visit Disneyland! Great experience for both, kids and adults.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepness nights”
Reviews.Author: Paul E
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights after being bounced from the hotel Monterosa. The room (102) was OK but the bed was the most uncomfortable I have ever had the misfortune to sleep upon and you could hear the metro rumble every five minutes so I had two sleepless nights. I would not recomend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “i do recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Liora D
Reviews.Content: i just came back from Paris,and i thought that it is importent to write down that this hotel is truly recommended! the room and shower were very comfortable and clean,the room is small but ,it was enough! free wi-fi service which was very importent to me, a second away from the Metro, nice bistro bars around, beautiful dining room good and rich breakfest,and most importent,really helpful staff very nice servise . I surly will come back there on my next visit to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: mau083
Reviews.Content: I've just returned from Paris and my daughter and I spent several nights at this hotel. The staff were extremely helfpul as we'd forgotten to stipulate "twin" beds and were given a double. They happily changed this the following night without any hassle to a lovely twin-room. Both bedroom and bathroom were extremely clean, as was the linen/towels, and I suspect the bathroom was relatively new as it was so nice. It's location is about 20 mins walk/4 mins taxi ride from Gare due Nord, and within easy walking distance of the Opera, Madeleine, and excellent shopping facilities, with the St Georges Metro station just 1 minute's walk away You can occasionally hear a very faint rumble from the Metro which possibly runs under the hotel, but it's almost imperceptible, and despite it's size, the hotel is very quiet. There are lots of little restaurants and bars nearby, and I'd recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Always nice!”
Reviews.Author: Jotajota77
Reviews.Content: I love the hotel and its neighbourhood, there is a metro station ridiculously close, nice brasserie on the corner to have some drinks and many good restaurants, great variety of choices. The hotel is well decorated, the staff is very helpful , its my second time there and we're planning to stay more times. Nice quiet block away from touristics overcrowded áreas.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: DJB60456
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at the last minute and found it to be very convenient to getting around Paris as the metro is literally steps away. We were in room 202 which faces the street with a small playground across the street. The price is reasonable by Paris standards with very clean rooms, comfortable beds and a small bathroom. The rooms also have a safe in the closet which I found to be a plus. The staff was very helpful and spoke pretty good English. The only complaint I have with the bathroom (I've seen this before in Europe) is that the partition in the shower is so small that the floor can get really wet.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: SJC_NZ
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice, and will certainly stay again. This is a beautiful decorated hotel with comfy beds and a high standard of cleanliness. The first time we stayed we had a standard room. The location is ideal for cafes, shops and transport, and it is also fairly quiet. The rooms are small, but completely normal for Paris. What we liked is that the bathrooms are not cramped - this is sometimes an annoyance in other Paris hotels! The second time we stayed we booked last minute (ours before arrival) and had probably the smallest room in the hotel - it was still very comfortable though. Then, because it was only available for one night and we needed to stay for two, we needed to book a more expensive room. They then also upgraded us, so we stayed in a suite! We didn't need all that space, but it was nice anyway, and I liked the view up the street. Breakfast is delicious and there is a lot of variety - it's worth the price. The staff are very friendly and helpful, speaking perfect English. But we did have a problem with one particular staff member. First of all he took a ridiculously long time to check us into our second room, even though we thought we sorted it out earlier. I was standing there in reception for 20 minutes! Then I asked him to book us a taxi for a specific time, and when we came down later we discovered he had forgotten! We were very upset as it almost made us late for a wedding. Luckily we walked and found one down the street. I don't think these mistakes reflect badly on the hotel as a whole, though. It's a relaxing and lovely place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Really cosy hotel within walking distance to shopping district”
Reviews.Author: Tonelone
Reviews.Content: We spent a few days here a few years ago and this is so far the bestf value hotel I've found in Paris. Relatively centrally placed, you can walk both to Gare du Nord and to Opera district. The metro is just outside the entrance and will bring you anywhere in Paris within a short while. The hotel is fresh, newly refurbished and very nice. The rooms are small, but where are they NOT small in Paris? Don't remember the quality of the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “first 2 stays great last stay awful.would not return.”
Reviews.Author: sandyb_nl
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here twice before and loved it but this time was terrible. We were put in a room on the ground floor with no air conditioning and it was 31degrees outside. We couldn't open the window as we were on the street level and the metro felt like it was just under the bed. when asked to be moved the staff told us the hotel was full. We are returning to Paris next April and we won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for Paris”
Reviews.Author: JayCeeMonKee
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for a recent business trip as I was looking for a hotel with character in the 9th arrondisement. I was pleased to find that the photos on their website were an accurate reflection on the ambience of the lobby and courtyard. I found the hotel was in a great location for sightseeing in the evening as it's easy walking distance of the Moulin Rouge and Sacre Coeur so even whilst on business I had time to see a few of Paris' landmarks. The hotel is very well located for the Metro as it's literally stumbling distance to St Georges and only a short walk up the hill to Pigalle. Personally, I didn't find the proximity to the Metro too much of a disturbance. Yes, in my room I could feel and hear the trains as they passed, but it wasn't enough to be an annoyance. My room was the only disappointment as it was shabby and in need of a minor refurb with cracks in the walls and peeling picture frames. However this was made up for in part by the warm and friendly service of the hotel staff - not always easy to find in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “My worst hotel experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: Jember075
Reviews.Content: I felt fairly confident choosing this hotel based on previous reviews. I made a big mistake! I hope I can stop others wasting their cash. Pro's... Close to the Metro. Cons... Too close to the Metro. It runs from 5:15am to 1:15 am every 4 minutes and rumbles like loud thunder under the bed. The very hard uncomfortable bed, on the main road, without double glazing and noisey scooters passing all night. I got so little sleep I was too tired to do much. The bathroom stunk of sewage all night too. When asking reception the women pretend they don't understand or the guy tried to hit on me. I will never come back here and really hope no one else does either!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a gem! Well worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: BorogirlSydney
Reviews.Content: This was a last-minute booking but it worked out extremely well. I have stayed in Paris before and could barely move around in the hotel room, yet the room we were given in the Lorette Opera was extremely spacious and comfortable with big balcony doors to let in the fresh air - and when closed, they blocked out the traffic noise effectively. The bathroom was clean and comfortable too, and there was plenty of storage for our clothes and luggage The place is in a great location - literally seconds away from Saint Georges Metro stop and very near some cool restaurants - and I found the staff to be extremely helpful as I lost my phone whilst out in Marais and one of the guys helped me sort out my insurance claim. All in all, the place is well worth the money and in a great central spot for sight-seeing, eating and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent little hotel”
Reviews.Author: schuey100
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights and thought that the hotel was fantastic value for money. The rooms were clean, the hotel staff friendly and the location was excellent. The breakfast was good and reasonably priced, the room was big enough and bathroom was in a great condition. The metro is a few yards away, there are a couple of nice cafes on the corner. The only downsides, a kettle in the room would have been nice, as would an iron/ironing board but other than that I can't fault it. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints at all!”
Reviews.Author: SBirch Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, pleasant staff, very clean rooms, amazing breakfast! Nice area, although noisy outside in the early morning. We booked a double room for ourselves and a twin room for our daughters, but in the event the twin room was much larger than the double and the twin beds were pushed together anyway, so I suggest you opt for the twin as they're the same price. The metro station is just across the road and although it isn't on a line that goes directly into Paris, you only have to change once. There is a ticket machine at the station where you can buy a "carnet" which is 10 tickets. 1 ticket is required per journey, no matter how many times you change trains. The hotel runs a shuttle to Disney, which was quite expensive, so we didn't use it, but it's an option if you don't want to bother with a rather tedious train journey on a very crowded train. There is no bar at the hotel, but reception staff will order drinks on your behalf if required. There is a pretty atrium with 4 tables which no one seemed to use, so we bought our own wine and sat there in the evenings. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Last minute mix up led to stay here and it was nice.”
Reviews.Author: PermanentNomad
Reviews.Content: I booked a eurostar/hotel package deal at the last minute. We were supposed to stay in a sister hotel however do to a reservation mix up we were moved to this hotel. The hotel is in a great location for walking as well as for the metro. It is located in a neighborhood with small restaurants and bars, stalls with fresh fruit etc. The common areas are nice and comfortable. Our room and bath were spacious and very clean. The breakfast buffet was great and offered a variety of food options. For the right price I would stay here again, I especially liked the 15 minute walk to Montmatre.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it - but not fantastic”
Reviews.Author: huyazo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good and you get what you pay for. It's clean, staff is friendly and location is just 100 m from St. George metro station. But the room and bathroom was quite small, the shower head was falling down, the bed quite hard, the air condition noisy, and you could hear the metro every time a train passed. On the good side, the view from the room was very nice toward a small park. The breakfast in the basement was ok, they had omeletts, fruit coctail and the ordinary bread/croiassant/cereals stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Find - Will Stay Again...and Again.”
Reviews.Author: Evan559
Reviews.Content: Searching for hotels in Paris can be a nightmare. Even the most prudent traveler can end up shelling out €200 a night for a horrendous room on the outskirts of town. Enter Lorette Opera: Bridging the gap between quality and affordability. The hotel is everything you need and everything you are looking for. The location can't be beat: Just up the street from the metro (St. George, Green Line) in a lovely and very safe part of town just below the Sacré-Coeur. The loby area is very modern, welcoming and nicely designed - clearly a recent remodel. The staff was incredibly helpful throughout our entire stay with everything from making restaurant reservations to helping us book and print our Eiffel tower tickets. A special "thank-you" to Riadh who went above and beyond to meet our every need. Our rooms were average sized for Paris - not unbearably cramped but not large by any measure. They are modern with new furniture and fixtures. Very comfortable beds and free WiFi that actually works! Everything was very clean except for the carpets which are in dire need of replacement - something we were willing to look past given the quality of everything else. American breakfast is €12 and well worth it - a great selection of food including basic omelets, fresh breads/croissants, cereals, yoghurts, etc. Housekeeping was outstanding with fresh towels and sheets every day. When we declined cleaning one day (someone in our party was sick and staying in the room all day) the housekeeping staff made sure to bring fresh towels without even being asked - better service than I've seen in far more expensive hotels. The value for everything you get here is outstanding. Every aspect (except for that carpet) far exceeded our expectations. If you are on the fence about booking because of the location, price or "Best Western" factor, stop reading this review and book it right now. You won't be disappointed. On a side note: You really feel like a local staying at the Lorette Opera with plenty of quality cafes, brasseries and boulangeries nearby...Make sure to try the No Stress Cafe up the street for an outstanding (and affordable) lunch and do not leave without going to the boulangerie/patisserie on the corner of Rue Des Martyrs and Rue Manuel - best baguettes and sandwiches we found in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Very good for 3* - I would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: TinaAthens
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is very convenient. The metro is too close (you can actually feel it passing in the breakfast restaurant!) and there are also 2 bus lines passing in front the hotel that take you to Louvre and Hotel de ville. Monmartre (Place Pigale) is a 10 min walking distance to the north and Opera 15 min walking south. The hotel is renovated and clean - lobby and rooms. Breakfast was very good with variety of cold dishes, many types of cheese, cereals, fruits (no warm dishes - except some eggs). Staff was friendly. The only issue is the absence of room service and mini bar / fridge and coffee / tea facilities in the rooms. Overall it's definitely very good value for the money spent.

Reviews.Title: “A simple yet great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JH1788
Reviews.Content: We recommended hotel Lorette so booked to go there during our trip to Paris. The hotel is simply yet stylishly decorated, especially the lounge / reception area. The service at reception was excellent, they were able to offer advice and happily booked a restaurant for us due to our poor French. We were upgraded to a superior room for no extra cost. The room was still on the small side, and its fittings were basic. However it was still comfortable and we had everything that we needed. It was also spotlessly clean. The bathroom was a very good standard. The location is great, located right by the underground station. It is only a ten minute walk to the Sacre Coeur. However down the street are a vast array of strip bars and sex shops, but you would expect this for the Montmatre area. If looking for a reasonably priced hotel in Montmatre I'd definitely stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms in very pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: JosephODonoghue
Reviews.Content: I always find Paris very difficult find a decent hotel for a good price. Normally you pay through the roof for a crap room. The Lorette Opera was a pleasant surprise. It was in a part of Paris which in I had never stayed in before, South Pigalle or SoPi, as the locals call it. It's down the road from Pigalle (red light district), but down the hill enough to not even notice it's there. On weekends, there is a massive antique market just down the road, Notre Dame de Lorette is a few minutes walk, and the hotel is in minutes walk from all the key metro lines. I liked having a change from Le Marais / Repubblique too. The area had a young trendy feel at night, with plenty of little restaurants and bars close by. Montmatre is literally 5 minutes walk up the road. The rooms were really nice. Clean, well presented and nicely decorated. The whole hotel is very modern and new. The bathroom was clean and modern. The hotel staff were really helpful, and even though the hotel was fully booked - we barely noticed it. The road outside was a little noisy on the Friday, but that is Paris. It's worth it to have a window over the street.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and simple hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Vix_k
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights. The hotel is really simple, bright and clean. The bed was v. comfortable and the bathroom was clean and modern. The room was warm and equipped with a safe and an extra radiator which we actually didn't need to use but it was nice to have the option. There was also free wifi in the room. The only downside was being placed in a twin room rather than in a double - though this was our fault for not specifying this in the booking, but apparently they didn't have any doubles available for us. Also I noticed the outside road noise a couple of times in the room though this never bothered us, nor did I ever notice this whilst getting to sleep at night. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful time at st lorette”
Reviews.Author: melliet
Reviews.Content: i had a great stay at this hotel. initially they gave us a room which smelled of cigarettes. we requested for a change of room and they were very obliging. they gave us a room on the top room and it was huge! we had a nice view of the streets too. the room was clean and the toilet was spotless! the heating was really good and it made the room so warm we had to open the windows to let some cool air in. it was also a 2min walk from the metro which was very convenient. it is also walking distance from the louvre ( half an hour walk) which would be pleasant on a good weather day. if not, grab a bus from across the street ( i think its bus number 76 but you can check with reception, they are super friendly) and you'll be there in 10 mins. great restaurants around too. we ate at the one near the statue at the roundabout right by the hotel. breakfast was great too with a large selection of food. overall i had a wonderful stay at this hotel and would be back again!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: ratnaghosh1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very cloase to St George's metro station and a very convinient location. It is also close to opera. Overally the hotel is clean but services were not so good. The room lock was not working. The room was very small and cramped , low ceiling. The internet was working quite well.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a weekend stay”
Reviews.Author: cizzallen
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel - it is right next to the metro at St Georges, and convenient for most of paris. The room was small but very comfortable and had everything you would need for a weekend away from a mid range hotel. We were able to get a late deal so the price was brilliant but it also included breakfast which was wonderful - served in an attractive stone walled room, it consisted of almost every breakfast item you could imagine (omlettes / ham / croissants / cheese / fruit / yogurts / tomatoes etc.etc.) and was plenty to fill up on until late afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “The employees at the front desk were extremely service oriented and pleasant.”
Reviews.Author: tedy01
Reviews.Content: Although this was not a 4 star hotel, the service we received made you feel as if it were. We felt very welcomed .The employees at the front desk were always ready to help and we were always received with a smile, something most Parisians are not known for. Our room was very clean and quiet. We enjoyed our stay very much and would not hesitate to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for an affordable but very decent hotel in Paris this is it!”
Reviews.Author: Fei26
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 5 days when I went to Paris by myself, it is literaly next to the metro station Saint Georges so it was very convinient when I returned by myself at night! It is walking distance (approximately 15 min. from Gal. La Fayette) and from other shops and 1 metro station from the amazing Monmartre. I have travelled to Paris 9 times. I have stayed in all shorts of hotels (from very expensive to low cost). This hotel is just fine, if you go there as a couple or a family it is clean, has good breakfast, the rooms were medium to small size (but if you have ever been to paris you would have seen much smaller rooms), generally it is a good choise if you consider the price and I personally had very quiet sleep. Especially for those tourists who are all day on the run it is excellent. And the staff was very friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Modern little hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Dimitris_Athens_8
Reviews.Content: We stayed in hotel BW Lorette Opera for 3 nights during a long weekend in Paris. We were given a room in the 3rd floor that was lovely, but unfortunately very small. The room and the bathroom were very clean with nice modern furniture and wifi.The bed was a little smaller than normal double beds but i suppose they were made to fit in the relatively small room of the hotel. The reception staff was good and professional and the lounge of the hotel nice and modern. The breakfast room was very nice and warm. For the brakfast itself i wasn't very satisfied as there was no hot buffet and the croisants were cold.Also there weren't many options to choose and for my opinion if you stay more than 2 days you will have to eat the same and the same every day. A very good thing is that St Georg Metro station is just 50 meters from the hotel so this makes it convenient to go downtown if you don't want to walk.From the airport you will have to change 3 times (RER train till Gare du Nord then 2 metros till hotel) We payed about 95 euros per night including breakfast and i think this was a good deal. I would stay there again in a future visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent little hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: willandkumi
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two days in this centrally located hotel and were very impressed. We booked a fairly cheap deal through Agoda so weren't too sure what we were going to get but were satisfied in every respect. The hotel has a lively design and nice courtyard that looks enjoyable in the warmer months. The staff all spoke english - as well as a variety of other langauges and were very knowledgable about the surrounding area, recommending number of good restaurants. Our room was clean and modern with a very nice bathroom and lounge area and as we travelled with a baby they helpfully provided a cot and some other items. All round we had a great experience and would recommend the hotel to almost all kinds of travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, clean and tidy, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_CB_22
Reviews.Content: Location - perfect, not even a stone's throw to the metro station giving easy access to the rest of the city. Room - compact but clean and tidy, everything I needed for a one night stay. One small downside, it was -2C outside but the room was boiling hot! Even with the aircon on, but not a show stopper. Breakfast - fresh croissants and good coffee, no complaints. Would be happy to stay at this hotel again on my next return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: Ferinha
Reviews.Content: I sometimes drive up to see my dad in Cleveland which is 6 hours away from DC. There have been times that I stopped along the way to sleep at a cheap motel. You know one of those side of the road things where you don’t like to sit on the toilet (I pee standing up) or use the cover? What does this have to do with this hotel in Paris? Well, I paid around $50 for the motel in Ohio and over $250 for the hotel in Paris. I rather stay on those side of the road Ohio hotels. Issues with this hotel: 1. Room smelled. 2. Internet didn’t work. 3. Maids knocked on the door even when the “Do Not Disturb” sign was on the door. 4. Room was smaller than normal (even for Paris). 5. Many staff were unfamiliar with customer service. 6. Had to borrow an iron and ironing board from downstairs. 7. Two twin beds pushed together is not a queen. 8. When I plugged into the Internet, it said that I had to pay. Turns out I didn’t, but wasn’t told that Internet was free when I checked in. Look, I can go on and on. We actually had checked into a smaller room, but when the queen size bed took up the entire room, I asked to change. Since I had used the bathroom (number one), I actually had to pay for another room if I wanted to change. Fine. This room was so small that I couldn’t walk around the bed without touching the walls. You get bigger rooms as a prisoner in Guantanamo. Better lighting too. The second room had very low ceilings. I’m 5’8” and I was almost touching the ceilings. The room had a strange smell. I couldn’t put my finger on it, but then realized that the maid was taking out the drain and leaving it out. This exposed shower drain to the pipes below and emitted the smell. That or the carpet had previously housed breeding rats. The Internet didn’t work. We tried it with two computers and were told that both of our computers, a Mac and a PC, weren’t compatible with the system. I called during my stay to complain and walked through my laundry list of issues. The manager didn’t do anything to fix my complaints, but dropped off what she said was the “best champagne in France”. I used my blackberry to see how much it was (my internet wasn’t working) and it costs $25 in the States. Suffice it to say, I returned the bottle. One night I came to the front desk as I had forgotten my key in the room. I handed my ID to the gentlemen at the front desk and explained to him that I had forgotten my key. He looked at me and asked me, “Why are you giving me this?” My ID? “Yes, I don’t need this.” Well, I explained, I’m giving you my ID so that you don’t give my room key to a homeless person coming in off of the street… I was here on business and not touring Europe as a poor college student. The only thing that was somewhat good about this neighborhood is the neighborhood hood in which it is located. It’s an area of Paris I hadn’t previously explored and it was nice to do so. Note of caution that it seems that prostitution is alive and well as you will walk by many massage houses and brothels in your walks around this hotel. I will never stay here again and personally thing that they should shut this hotel down, fire all the staff and never talk about this again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, newly refurbished hotel”
Reviews.Author: VikingOpolo
Reviews.Content: Arrived late. On check-in I asked for a US/Japan flatpin to roundpin electrical plug converter. Did not have. I had a fit as both iphone & macbook very low on juice, simplest converter cost the hotel about 50¢ to buy, I happily will pay 1-2$ for this. Next morning I got a converter to borrow. Otherwise nice newly refurbished hotel three star hotel. Recommended! Very good bed, good TV and airconditioner. Only other problem was low pressure in shower, so it took forever to have a shower, which I don't have time with as I'm a buisness traveller. Usually I stay in good 4-5 star hotels in Paris but due to a medical conference everything below $900 was full, so I opted to go down, as I spend own money. This hotel was mainly a happy supprise for the money spent. Location so-so only/.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate hotel conveniently located near to metro station”
Reviews.Author: AJC22
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and booked two rooms, one for ourselves and one for our teenage son and our ten year old. The hotel is situated near to St Georges metro which as other reviewers have said gives access to the whole of Paris, you have to change lines about four times to get to the Eiffel Tower but especially at night is well worth the effort. when it sparkles on the hour for ten minutes. Magical! On arrival we were met (eventually) by quite a surly and abrupt receptionist, he didn't ask how our trip had been or welcome us to the hotel, a very disappointing start. The hotel rooms are very small, our room (406) overlooked the road and unfortunately we were awoken by roadworks every morning at 8.15. We had to strip the bed off as the quilt and sheets were stale and had stains on them, they were replaced with itchy blankets instead of a fresh quilt....not good! The bathroom is adequate but the shower has very little pressure. Only two British tv channels both news but its bearable for a couple of days. The boys enjoyed the free wi-fi but discovered you have to get new codes every day as it only lasts 24 hours at a time. Their room (412) was very small and they had constant noise from the apartment block adjacent to their room, loud music and shouting which kept them awake. We didn't have breakfast as we felt that 15 euros a head very expensive, but then eating out in Paris is very very expensive, we bought crossiants and orange juice from shops and ate al fresco as it was much cheaper than the hotel or cafes who can change over 5 euros just for a small glass of orange juice. The best thing about the hotel is probably the location of the metro station across the road from where you can easily explore this large and very expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff, Clean Rooms - But Expect to Walk”
Reviews.Author: ColInvictus
Reviews.Content: If you don't mind walking or taking the metro in Paris, then this hotel is exceptional for a middle-quality hotel in a busy city. The staff is friendly and kind. The rooms were clean and well supplied with anything we needed. There is a quiet and less-busy metro stop right next to the hotel which connects you to all of Paris. The neighbourhood is generally quiet - no main streets and feels very safe. An excellent place to stay on your first trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “cozy”
Reviews.Author: zhosze
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a bad experience in another hotel around the corner (see hotel Clauzel). I don't usually go for chain hotel but having the bad experience at a "local" hotel this was a relieve. It is very well maintained hotel and a pretty good rate, we stayed for 81 euro. The breakfast buffet was pretty extensive, we even packed some lunches for picnic. Rooms are small but extremely comfortable and very clean. The staff are super friendly and they even waived the 15 euro breakfast charge after our harrowing escape from the other hotel. I think they do waive it in slow months, so ask for it.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy and excellent price-quality relation”
Reviews.Author: zinho007
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for two nights and have to admit that it is far better then the average quality of a Best Western Hotel. The whole interior and the rooms are designed as a Boutique Hotel with a very individual touch. Friendly reception and free WIFI are additional elements for feeling comfortable. The location is excellent as you are close to Opera as well as to Montmatre. Finally, the price-quality relation is outstanding. If you have the possibility to chose, get room 502 - it is worth seeing it. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “No hot water for 3 days, not enough effort to have it sorted”
Reviews.Author: sophiemaBeckenham
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel online for 2 nights, Friday to Sunday 14-16 May 2010. We were not told at arrival that there was no hot water, I discovered it by myself having a cold shower having to wash my long hair. When I phoned the reception after that, they said they knew and that it would be sorted the next morning, which it wasn't. On Saturday morning, they said we could have a shower in a hotel that belongs to the same company 200 meters away and that we could move there. We didn't bother, as we didn't want to move all our stuff there. We also thought the problem would be sorted during the day. It wasn't. They didn't offer a discount or another kind of compensation. Warning: you can hear the metro going under the hotel. So about every 3 minutes, it's quite unsettling, especially as you don't know what it is first. Then I remembered vaguely I had read this on this site (after booking it, of course). On arrival, I found a short black hair on the bathroom shelf. On Saturday, when we came back to our room in the evening, there was a used pillow case left on the desk and the 2 items that go in the plughole (of the shower) were taken out and left on the shower tray, leaving a big gaping hole . I had to put them back myself. Not complicated but you don't expect that kind of thing. However, the breakfast room is lovely and there's a nice selection of things to eat and drink. Great atmosphere and decoration in this room. Lovely staff. And you can have breakfast till 11am, which was great for us who like lie-ins. About the reception staff: it depends, some were really nice and helpful. On the last day, we could really feel we were bothering the 2 ladies asking about compensation. But one lady gave us the manager's card and said we should ask money back through the web agency we used to book our hotel. But that if we had trouble, we could contact the manager of the hotel. We'll see what happens. About wifi, when my boyfriend went down to reception to ask for the new wifi code, he was left feeling like he was asking for a favour. When you look at the hotel's pictures, you can really be misled into thinking your room and bathroom are going to look big like their pictures. Our room was really small and the bathroom too. But it was modern and had a nice flat screen TV. Noise wise, be warned, there is the metro noise and as the rooms are not double-glazed, you will hear some traffic and people speaking (or worse) during your night (if your room overlooks the street). So for £216 for 2 nights, I expected a bigger room, hot water and better service. Too expensive for a 3 star to start with and even worse without hot water. You would expect the manager to pay whatever has to be paid to sort the problem out within hours, not days...who knows when the problem had started.

Reviews.Title: “They always omit and cover their mistake; not put customers at their priority”
Reviews.Author: Almond2011
Reviews.Content: This is my first time to go Paris with my GF and have a high expectation to have Romance & Fun experience; but the hotel screw up my dream. First, they don't check the room condition before we checked in. Such as the broken floor by the washroom door which I am almost trap to fall; the therometer was not work which hanged to the wall. Third, there is no signal of "make up room & don't disturb" to hang on the door. They don't help to solve the 1 st problem by helping the cutomers to move the luggages to the other room even their fault; the manager broke the promise not have any room to exchange and not giving the gift basket as compliment. Also the technician was not make sure no one in room before access to our room while we had cloth-changing!! This is the worst traveling experience to stay the hotel I never had in my life....

Reviews.Title: “Loud and hot!”
Reviews.Author: beckastevenson
Reviews.Content: Great location, modern, clean reception, our room was clean but small and basic. The radiator was on full blast when we arrived and despite my best efforts we were unable to change the temperature, this wasn't a huge problem as we were out all day until of course we wanted to sleep. As we were on the first floor up the traffic kept us awake until 2am so although the room was boiling we were unable to have the window open, bring ear plugs! The breakfast in the basement had a wide selection, although the lady checking your room number seemed a little abrupt, just a smile goes a long way! This was a surprise weekend so my experience of Paris was lovely in its own right, I just generally think the standards are slightly lacking in France compared to the UK.

Reviews.Title: “best western lorette opera hotel”
Reviews.Author: laykee
Reviews.Content: the hotel deserves a 4-star rating. rooms are big enough and are always clean. and the location is very good just few steps away from train station.

Reviews.Title: “A tastful blend of the present and past century”
Reviews.Author: sushimonkey
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only 10 mtr from St Georges Metro stop, in a quiet street, but 7min walk from the famous Place Pigalle. Staff was very friendly and helpfull, we had a room on the top floor so we could enjoy the view on the Eiffel tower from the Velux windows. (if you petite like me you'll have to stand on a chair...) Room was very clean, mattress very confortable felt like sleeping at home. There was a separate room with sofa, and wardrobe. And the bathroom, I enjoyed a long bath after all that walk during the day. I didnt see it first but they will give you complementary bath set if you need. Also nearby there is an 'Epicery de nuit' open late independant grocery store with all the basics you need. There is international TV, broadband. The breakfast is 'a la francaise' mostly sweet pastries, yogurt.... only a few savoury bits.

Reviews.Title: “dirty!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dfl789
Reviews.Content: don't even consider this hotel. the pillows, sheets, blankets are old. blanket we have even looks unwashed since we saw several strands of hair, white sheet also has hair and when we asked the front desk to change it, the guy insisted that it is clean and that there are no extra blankets that can be provided. we slept with towels on our pillows.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of customer service let down this contemporary hotel!”
Reviews.Author: citygalyorks
Reviews.Content: Was unsure when booking as this hotel had mixed reviews. What appealed was that the hotel looked very contemporary and was reasonably priced. On arrival i thought wow! The reception and the sitting area were beautifully decoarated with twinkling lights and contemporary furniture and a beautiful courtyard to the back. There were 3 staff at reception when we arrived, none very welcoming, no smiles and how was your trip?! Same on checkout - no hope you enjoyed your stay, was everything to your liking? The room was standard, basic but clean and comfortable. Such a shame there was no bar or restaurant as the communal areas of the hotel are beautiful but unused! There wasn't even seating in the courtyard! I wouldn't stay again as poor customer service is a big no no for me but location wise this hotel was ideally situated across the road from the St Georges metro stop and obviously ideal if you're visiting the opera. However if you want to stay out late into the night you will have a bit of a walk as the bars and bistros round and about seemed to close very early (ie once the shows start around 9pm). No frills - this hotel is what it is!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: lnj4boogie
Reviews.Content: After 5 days in London we decided to stay in Paris for two nights. We flew from Luton and took the RoissyBus which for 8.40 euro drops you off in the Opera district, which fortunately is where the hotel is. If you are looking to take the metro the hotel is most closely located near the St. Georges stop. Its literally a 1 minute walk up the hill. Check in was easy, they allowed us to check in early (as we had purchased on Orbitz everything was paid for). The room is tiny, yet clean and comfy. PERFECT for one evening for a couple. A standard bed, shower, shower gel and soap included, a closet with shelves and some side tables. The room was one floor up and faced the street. As has been noted the room was very hot and opening the windows allows the city noise in. I'm from the city, so traffic noise etc doesn't bother me. It was a quaint hotel, and being so close to the Metro it made getting to everything fine (if your not afraid of taking public transportation). The staff was nice and recommeded decent places to eat. I would recommed for short quick stays to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Management terrible, Reservation system is a scam”
Reviews.Author: ustun_yildiz
Reviews.Content: I have selected this hotel because it was recently renovated. I have used their homepage to make a reservation with my credit card. When I showed up after a long flight from SFO, they told me there is no available room although I had a confirmation for my reservation. They sent me to another Best Western hotel which was quite ugly. I have accepted this because I was quite tired. On my the way back to US, I have seen that my credit card was charged for a non-showup. This is a total scam. I have to go the whole process to make the refunding procedure.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your earplugs!”
Reviews.Author: MJJ001
Reviews.Content: Neither air conditioning nor fan worked leaving us to open the window. Would be fine with that, but the area is very, very loud at night and does not settle down until 2am or later. After second night of no sleep and a hot room, we finally wised up and used ear plugs and got our first decent night's sleep. Our non-smoking room was small (no surprise, what we expected for Paris), but was surpised that guests staying in the room below ours liked to smoke out their window. Had to close the windows AND use earplugs to avoid having our clothes and room reek of cheap cigarettes. Convenience to the Saint-Georges metropolitan stop was very nice though. The breakfast included with the rate was decent and the hotel on the whole was modern and well-kept considering its age. Hotel staff is clueless about ice and when they do make it, they give you about 1/2 a glass of ice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Modern Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: cookiebear88
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in February with my boyfriend for three nights. The location of the hotel is great...right next to a Metro station. I would say, however, that you may want to avoid walking far up the hill as you will end up in the heart of the red light district but down the hill is really lovely. Hotel is close to Sacre Coeur and all other tourist attractions are easily accessible by Metro. The hotel itself was good. It has a modern decor and is kept very clean. The rooms are a little small but perfect for a short stay. The only drawback to the hotel as there is no bar or anything like that so you really have to go out of the hotel for a quiet drink. Also, only breakfast is available from the hotel. Overall the hotel is pretty good, especially for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal!”
Reviews.Author: AnderTate
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great deal! You can tell that it has been recently renovated, so that's a plus and makes up for the size of the room (which really isn't as small as we expected based on some of the reviews). The hotel is located in an area off the beaten path, with makes for great deals and a more authentic experience at the Shopi (grocery store across the street), fromagerie, boulangerie, etc.—for those DIY-ers like ourselves. But the Brasserie and Cafe deals in the area are also great, and the whole vibe is less touristy than other parts, yet it's still feels very accessible to the rest of Paris (with the metro being steps away). Staff is cool. Breakfast and internet not included, and no gym, which could be helpful with all the cheese, bread and desserts! My boyfriend and I would likely stay again when we return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “great last minute deal”
Reviews.Author: rustieNornIreland
Reviews.Content: We were given this last minute deal as a present. It was a nice, modern, well finished hotel. The location is good as it is a really close to the Metro and there were lots of little cafes/shops etc. The only negative was the breakfast at 14 euro each a bit expensive for us so we didnt eat there. We had a room at the back which was small but very clean and comforable it was also very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “So good we came back twice!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Helentbag
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd stay in a year at this hotel. It ticks all the boxes for its price range. Good price, good location (5min- ish walk from Gare du Nord and Montmartre), child friendly, lovely staff ,(particularly Ma- Mpey on reception who welcomed us back like old friends. She is a delight.) quiet (though I will come back to this later), great decor and design, clean, (I think it was only renovated last few years so everything has a "new" feel about it) comfortable, and with a great buffet breakfast choice. The only problem this trip was that our room was on the 1st floor so more disturbance at night from street noise and Metro. Higher up last trip (3rd floor) and no noise at all. High chairs and travel cots available. Buses opp hotel go straight to Louvre, Hotel de Ville and St George metro is opp. Short walk to Moulin Rouge etc or opp direction Grand Blvds and dept stores. There are some nice restaurants nearby but you have to search for them!! A lot of the good ones close at weekend that you will see in the guide books. Love Phillipe Starke furniture so the design was appealing to me. Rose petals on the lift ceilings,... little touches like that. Lovely. It won the Best Western Hotels "Oscar" last year for best hotel and I think it deserved it. Negatives - this time they had not put the cot in the room before but said they would as soon as we got there which we declined as he is in the bed most of the night anyway as most parents reading this will nod in agreement. The room was on a low floor as I said so there was noise disturbance but not too bad to warrant not coming back. There is no bar or restarant and this would improve the hotel. Other than that there is nothing I could say against it. I love this hotel so there are no guesses where I will stay next time I visit!! It is The Lorette Opera every time for me now. Have not included the photos as other peoples on here are exactly the same. Go see for yourself, you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Stay”
Reviews.Author: hmic10
Reviews.Content: Just what I expected; Thought the room was clean and bright, a little small, but to be expected. The staff was okay not rude but overly friendly. I though the location and the area was great. The were able to call us a cab. I would stay here again. Loved the lobby and the decor. Bathroom did get a little wet from the shower, but overall I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel - pity about the staff”
Reviews.Author: MissRichardson
Reviews.Content: I booked a weekend away for my Boyfriends birthday for the 31 Oct to the 2nd November with dialaflight. We found the Hotel to be very clean and tidy, and literally a minutes walk from the Metro. The rooms were a little on the small size but perfect if you are staying for the weekend wanting to take in the beautiful sights of Paris. Unfortunately I have to say, we were very disappointed with the staff. We found them to be unhelpful and in some cases rude. The Hotel booked us two rooms when we only required one. They refused to see how a couple would want two rooms, and when I asked for the appropriate paperwork to send to dialaflight they refused outright and said the fault did not lie with them in a very discourteous manner. Fortunately Dialaflight was more than helpful and the matter has now been resolved. In conclusion, Paris is beautiful, the people there are so helpful - it is such a shame I cannot say this about the hotel!.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Holidaymaker034
Reviews.Content: The hotel is less than a minute away from the St Georges Metro, when you reach the street, just look up the hill and the hotel is on the right. There is also a bus stop opposite the hotel for the 67 and 74, both of which take you to the Seine and up to the Pigale. We did not have breakfast at the hotel, but there was a bar around the corner that did a great breakfast for 5 euro (compared to the hotel's 14 euro) Our room was clean and compact , the bed was firm. We had a first floor room, which initially concerned us, as we thought it may be noisy, but this was not the case. Overall, a great location within easy reach of all the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “No encore for Lorette Opera”
Reviews.Author: Nigel022
Reviews.Content: Having booked a double room, very disappointed to be shown a twin room on the ground floor. The double room available turned out to be small and over-looking a busy street. Also, you have to ask for the complimentary tea/coffee tray with kettle; which probably tells you all you need to know about this hotels attitude to guests. The choice at the buffet breakfast was good though.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves every star and more!”
Reviews.Author: mcpp
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our trip and I couldn't have rushed faster to write this review. Because I think the bad reviews here do this hotel no justice. It is very clean, VERY central and the staff are extremely helpful. We stayed 4 nights, on our first night we did not like the fact that we were given a room with a shower instead of a bath and complained about it. The night receptionist told us he'd do his very best and assured us a room with a bath for the next morning. The next day we were moved to another room with smiles, which was more spacious and with a bath. All around I loved the hotel. There is only 1 negative remark I can make and that takes the 5th star off my rate: the fact that the bathroom got so WET so fastly is really unacceptable. They should do something about it, put a glass door around the bath or whatever..Because the guests can get injured But let me tell you the housekeeping saw that we'd put towels on the ground so we wouldn't fall, they gave us 3 extra towels each day so we could keep the floor dry after taking a shower...That was very nice of them. There is roomservice, I believe until 2 am.. with drinks and full course food choices. Free iron and ironboard. Also free hospitality tray with coffee and sorts of tea... There's also a lobby area where you can order drinks... All around I'd say this hotel realy deserves 4 stars... I'd go back and stay there anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: RobgLondon
Reviews.Content: The Lorette Opera is a great little hotel located in the St Georges area of Paris. It is literally a stone's throw from the metro station, a couple of stops from the bustling Montmartre and a short way to the rest of the sights of Paris. The communal areas of the hotel were stylishly decorated and the reception staff were polite and friendly. The rooms were pleasant and kept very clean. They were not overly large, but they were fitted out with air conditioning and a flat screen TV. Overall we enjoyed our stay at the Lorette Opera and would recommend it as being good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “You Need To Read This”
Reviews.Author: LibertyLeo
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Management was Horrible. We booked our room online and paid in advance. They double charged us for two rooms due to computor error. Weeks before staying we notified them and Best Western and were told tough luck. Best Western tried to refund our money but the Hotel manager refused. He told us tuff luck because they already have our money!!!!! We though we could work it out while we were there but they shut the door in our face! The hotel staff apologized and offered us a free breakfast..... wow that makes up for it. Luckly we booked with an Amx travel card and disputed the charge and it was removed. I would never, never, never stay there as they treated us so horrible. The hotel Lobby may look good from the outside but not from the inside! We travel a great deal and have never been treated like this in our life.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: InQueens26
Reviews.Content: I was a little weary about staying at the opera area but we were not int hat area often, there is a convenient train across the street and two buses that go straight to the Louvre area. We got off once on stop away and you can tell it was shady and there were prostitutes in shops but as long as you just get off where you are supposed to, you will be fine. The hotel is very nice, bery brights, marble, not crampped but nice, and air conditioning that worked very well. I felt that it was nice and renovated and nothing to complain about. Our standards were not high after hearing about European hotels but when we got there I was so happy cause it seemed like it would be a good stay which it was. They even called a cab for us and it came fast.

Reviews.Title: “A really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Herondancer
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel recently as part of a business trip to Paris. Check-in was very efficient. Had asked for a single room and was pleasantly surprised to be given a twin room on the second floor at the front of the hotel. It was a perfect size for one person and would be more than adequate for two people. The room and ensuite were both very neat and clean, housekeeping was obviously up to scratch. The flat screen TV was a nice touch. Even though the room looked out onto a busy street, it could not be described as noisy at any time (in fact, the background noise of people passing below added to the character of the stay.) It was two days into my stay when I realised that the metro line actually ran under the hotel. It was like a gentle hum each time it passed below. Breakfast was one of the best I have had in a Paris hotel with plenty of choice. There are a number of very nice restaurants in a small square behind the hotel. I'd certainly recommend the "No Stress Cafe" - it summed up this hotel and its surroundings for me. One small tip - if you are travelling by Metro, the St George station is almost outside the front door, while Pigalle station is well within walking distance as well - in fact it is probably quicker and easier to walk from that station than to transfer to the St George if you are coming from that direction. It is certainly more interesting !!! The only downside is that I would not recommend walking from the Pigalle station after dark.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK!”
Reviews.Author: MichelleJR
Reviews.Content: My husband took me to Paris for my birthday and we had a wonderful time! When we were looking for hotels we didn't chose a really cheap one as we wanted a few mod cons, unfortunately we didn't really get them with this place. Of course we were expecting the room to be small (as most are in Paris) and on a positive note it was clean and the bed was very comfortable, but unfortunately although it was advertised as having in-room tea and coffee making facilities we didn't have any. We asked at reception for a 'hospitality tray' on our first night , I really wanted a cup of tea before bed, to be told that they didn't have any, they didn't have one on the second or third night of our stay either - I know this is only a little thing, but it did irritate me!!! My full marks really go to the staff at his hotel, I don't think I've stayed in another place where the staff were so nice. On a slightly different note, the closest metro to the hotel is St. Georges on the 'dark green' line, to get to it; come out of the hotel and turn left and it is about two minutes away. Plus if you're going to the Sacre Cour you're better off getting the bus from one of the stops near the hotel than to get the metro to Montemartre. Also if you're going to The Pantheon, most of the guide books say that it is open until 9pm - it isn't, it has changed and it's now only open till 6pm! Oh and for a delicious brunch try upstairs at The George - outside the metro station. Most importantly take good walking shoes people - you don't want your feet bleeding at The Louvre like mine were!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Tidy, Small”
Reviews.Author: janusian
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, tidy, and has been recently refurbed. The rooms are standard hotel fare in terms of appointment, and they are small. The lobby is smart and bright, and breakfast is perfectly acceptable, and not bad value by hotel standards. Local to a metro station. Good hotel if you just want somewhere clean and easy whilst you spend your time exploring Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Give it a try”
Reviews.Author: Scot27
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. It is easy to get there from Cdg airport. There is a metro station minutes from the hotel. If you want to go and visit places like the Eiffel Tower, arc de triomphe etc it is so easy from this hotel. The nightlife, cafe's and restaurants are in abundance in this area. They are also reasonable priced. The hotel is small, rooms can vary in size. We paid for a classic room and it was a good size, however, did see a smaller room and they are pretty small, but you are only sleeping in them. The breakfast was 14 euros per person per day, not worth it, I would say that around 9 euros would be a better price. We did go out for breakfast and found a cafe just 500 yards away and breakfast for two was 14 euros. There is no bar in the hotel, which is a pity, because we always enjoy a nightcap before retiring to bed. All in all I thought this was a great hotel, and I would definately return to this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Lovley but take care of your shower's damp ;-)”
Reviews.Author: kmusil
Reviews.Content: We have been in Paris and stayed at this hotel for 4 nights over new year's eve. PROs We liked this tiny hotel very much, which we booked over our Travel Agent. We requested a room in the 6th floor and got #601. Very cute, stylish and cool! Sleeping area, sitting area, flat TV screen (but who would use it on holiday in this City?) and a quite small bathroom, all very clean. Room was not too big, but we only wanted to stay there for sleep and what for having a huge room then? Many "hot spots" are very close and within walking distance, metro is quasi near the hotel (one block). You will find many nice restaurants within 5 min walk around the hotel, either french or foreign like indian, lebanese, japanese, chinese, greek,... all tiny restaurants, cute and friendly. we did not book anything for new years eve but found a perfect restaurant without problems. 7 min to Moulin Rouge - and some bigger discos/clubs for "night owls". 20 min to Sacre Coeur. 20 min to Louvre. 10 min to Galery Lafayette/Haussman and also the Opera. NEUTRAL Info Take care of your head, if you are bigger than 180cm ;-) as you are directly located under the roof - see the pics. You could feel (we never heard it) the metro especially in the lower floors eg. breakfast room. But up there in the 6th floor never. Staff and service was ok, friendly and helpful but not above average. breakfast buffet was ok and richer then expected but I would not like to pay € 11 or even more for that (it was included in our fee). CONs Some othere reviews were telling about fire alarms. I can confirm this, as I myself activated it one time. It was really cold in the room, allthough the radiator was on. It did not have more then 18/19 degrees celcius - and the bathroom had no radiator/heater/underfloorheating at all. obviously there is a bad insulation (as mentioned before you are directly under the roof) so it was really [-] cold in the bathroom - definitely 2 degrees below the room temp outside - this IS inconvenient to my opinion. additionally there is a van running day and night in the bathroom (which btw is quite noisy if you want to leave your door open to get it at leat a bit warmed during the night) with such a strong pull that that you felt in on your body. well, take a hot shower and find out what happens with the quickly developping damp... it soon caresses the fire dedector on the quite low roof and - yes - activates it. Well, they definitely have this prob more often, because when they phoned us they just asked: is there really a fire or is somebody taking a shower and left the door open?... So, take care of that ;-). All in all we would definitely recommend it and would come back to this place - now we know how to handle the shower ;-) Br km

Reviews.Title: “Fab Location - best for those who don't stay in!”
Reviews.Author: Fairylu
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel before so we knew what we were getting but were delighted to, this time, be on the fourth floor, in a slightly bigger room than the third floor room we stayed in in Feb 07. It was the view that made the room. We could just see the top section of the Eiffel Tower, over the rooftops so we could watch the light displays! As we were overlooking the street this time I was absolutely amazed how much noise the windows shut out. You can hear the metro, it's true, but that is a small price to pay for being so conveniantly close to it! My criticisms would be: a) returning at midnight after a day of sightseeing in the freezing cold we found our window open. I assume that was an honest mistake though - not common practice, b) when I asked one the reception staff about Christmas markets she was clearly iritated to asked and printed me off a list of 2005 events! That said when we left the hotel a different receptionist got us a taxi to go to the Gare du Nord in about 5 minutes. (You could equally walk there too - we did on the way there). In short, clean, great location, small rooms but hey, do you really go to Paris to sit in your hotel room?!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Fire Alarms”
Reviews.Author: snodrift
Reviews.Content: PROS: Style: I really liked the hotel- minimalist mod with a nod to the historical structure- exposed beams painted white. Cool plastic chairs done in pop colors. Cleanliness: Superclean Good beds Size of room: I was staying in room 601 which is big. It has a cool little living area and the room has a sloped roof- it felt like being in a space-age garret. I also spent some time in 602 which was smaller without the living area but had a huge bathroom. CONS: Loads of fire alarms: I experienced about 5 fire alarms on five different mornings. I think I was there the same time Tones100 (read his/her funny review below!). I was with the guy in the long old fashioned night shirt- I was laughing because he was the only one with traditional nightwear on- he really stuck out. Stupid showers: It requires lots of skill not to get the bathroom sopping wet. I would sacrifice the "coolness" factor for an effective barrier. Ditsy desk staff: They were pretty incompetent. Also, our phone didn't work upon checking in and they were totally unhelpful about it and not apologetic at all. We had to wait 4 days to get a phone. Which meant spending a lot of time in the public phone booth in the park with a calling card. I spent a few nights around the corner at 3 Poussins (on rue Clauzel) and i have to say i preferred it to the Hotel Lorette. It was more traditional in style but a lot more quiet, competent staff, and most importantly no unnecessary fire alarms one after another. I

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend”
Reviews.Author: Milla04
Reviews.Content: My first impressions of this hotel were good - the foyer is very pleasant, nice décor and clean - but the room was disappointing. It was also not clean - there were black hairs on the floor and bed covers and I'm blonde! A cleaner also entered my room in the morning despite there being a 'do not disturb' sign on my door. The ladies on reception were also very unfriendly. The only really positive point about this place was the location - right by the Saint-Georges underground station.

Reviews.Title: “A good 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: IsaacBeloHorizonte
Reviews.Content: The reviews on this site were rigth. It´s a really good 3-star hotel. The hotel has a pleasent decoration, the room is very small, but We could deal with it. On our first morning the fire alarm turned out, but thanks good was just a inconvenient false alarm. The only problem with this hotel is it´s staff. On the check out a unpolity recepcionist tried to double charged me, but, I showed him the payment receipt and his face blushed. After all, I still recommend this hotel for those who want to pay less and have some comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Can't recommend this enough - fantastic”
Reviews.Author: MissPhirefly
Reviews.Content: We paid £51 per night (room only) for two nights via Travelres.com. We were pretty impressed to find the rack rate for our room was 230 Euros (£156) but I would imagine people would happily pay that for such a great hotel. I chose the Lorette based on its website and reviews here. The general consensus of the reviews seemed to be fabulous hotel, very small rooms. As we were friends travelling together and didn't intend to spend too much time in the room, we thought that was something we were prepared to compromise on. We must have had good karma when we booked as our room though as it was huge (#202). Well appointed, immaculately clean and with some fun touches such as the perspex chairs, we were extremely impressed. Not quite luxe boutique, but the price reflected that. The rest of the hotel lived up to the images on the website and then some. The location was perfect for our first-time trip to Paris, a great base from which to explore the local Montmartre area and right opposite a metro station for forays further afield. Staff were professional and welcoming. The breakfast was good value (11E) compared to local cafes and the breakfast room was lovely. My only negative observation is that at night we could clearly hear the underground trains below even though we were on the 2nd floor. But they weren't so loud that they kept us awake. We just wanted a convenient pad, but with this hotel we got much more. Perfect .

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and well priced in expensive Paris”
Reviews.Author: beststay
Reviews.Content: In a good location but not perfect...but is located right next to Saint Georges metro stop..... Great decor in the rooms Service at front desk maybe a little rude but a little thing in the scheme of things. Great place to for reliable service and well priced stay in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Good boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoshesBoy
Reviews.Content: Ended up here by accident as another Best Western hotel had double booked us. This was a bonus as this place was really nice. Clearly recently refurbished in a "modern" way and it was definitely a pleasing hotel to be in, from the breakfast room, the reception and the rooms. Don't be fooled by all the photos on Expedia - you're likely to end up in a far smaller room but they are still clean and comfy. Agree with some comments re reception - they're not the smiliest of people and the sound of the metro might not be to everyone's satisfaction. Breakfast is also the standard cold affair and possibly not worth the effort. Being within 30 yards of the St Georges metro stop makes the location all the better and montmartre is a 15 minute walk uphill (obviously). If you can get this place for a reasonable rate it's definitely one to go for. Would definitely stay again..

Reviews.Title: “Very comfy”
Reviews.Author: Mona88
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 4 nights..staff were polite ,although the lady on reception on our first day i found to be a little rude. hotel room we had was small but it did us,wc and aircond worked perfectly..noise of metro didnt disturb us too much..location itself was perfect not too touristy which i liked.we had breakfast in the opera quater which i found to be a much better option than the hotel breakfast.also theres a great little pizzeria near the hotel which i would highly recommend. st georges metro is at the step on the hotel but everything is pretty much in walking distance ,as it was 30 degrees we mostly walked everywere. all in all this hotel was very comfortable and a nice place to crash after a long day of sight seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday treats in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Lucian_angel
Reviews.Content: Thanks Aitch, Well recommended! I booked up over the internet for a two night romantic weekend for my boyfriend's birthday. We went via Eurostar, the trip there was simple and easy. Once we arrived at Gare du Nord we got a taxi to Lorette Opera - about 12 euros. The hotel was clean and welcoming. The staff were pleasant and helpful but not in your face. The room we were in was clean and had a nice view of the classic narrow french street with the the numerous balconies - Very romantic and chic. The night life around the hotel - well if you like fun you'll love it here. There are many bars, restaurants and shops. There are many sights to see and Pigalle and Montmartre is heaving with night life and the famous Moulin Rouge! The hotel is literally across the road from St Georges metro. I felt very safe walking around at night everyone was so friendly. The hotel had room service but unfortunately the night we actually wanted it they closed because everyone was celebrating the Elections but no worries because there are cafes opened late and a local shop open all night. Breakfast was standard continental and the restaurant is beautiful with its arches and exposed white washed brick work. A lovely hotel. Only grip is the sower screen is not at all practical so water splashes everywhere - bring your flipflops! I would return again there was just too much too see and do. Hope you'll try it.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and Stylish”
Reviews.Author: SEMB
Reviews.Content: I spent three lovely nights at the Lorette Opera during a fantastic trip to Paris earlier this month. The hotel boasts stylish, modern decor and the lobby, downstairs breakfast room and outside terrace are of particular note with their exposed brickwork and chic furnishings. The rooms could be considered small (you are in Paris after all!) and a few did have a problem with the air conditioning system (we were quickly moved to a much larger room as a result) but they were clean, comfortable and had stylish bath/shower rooms. The in-built room safe was an added bonus. Location-wise the hotel is within walking distance of the lively Pigalle and Montmatre districts (and the Sacre Coeur) in one direction and the fashionable Opera district in the other. There is a metro stop just outside the hotel and you can travel directly to the Place de la Concorde and the Left Bank in a few minutes. The Metro stays open till 1am so getting to and from the hotel is easy. The hotel has no bar but there is a small square nearby where you can enjoy the Parisian cafe culture, which I much preferred! Overall, I would definitely recommend this hotel: it offered great value for money (especially if breakfast is included) and the staff were very helpful. All in all an excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “O.K.”
Reviews.Author: JBB3
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights. Location is good, rooms are very small but clean. Staff can be a bit grumpy. Breakfast is not worth the money, rather go to a bistro next door and start your day in a decent way. Overall, I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: CiaoWicklow
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights. The hotel reception and breakfast areas are very nice but the bedrooms are tiny but clean. The staff were not that friendly. Breakfast (continental) were average and charged at €11 per person which we found to be very expensive. The hotel is situated just opposite the metro station (St George) which is great after a days sightseeing/shopping to hop on the metro and not have a long walk back to your hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very Refreshing Stay”
Reviews.Author: ParasNYC
Reviews.Content: My stay at Lorette Opera was really quite pleasant. I was greeted by a warm and friendly staff and a chilled bottle of orange juice. Very nice touch after such a long flight. Hotel is chic and stylish and I loved the simplistic ornation and how some of the ornate details of the original structure were blended into the hotel. Some great pieces of furniture in the lobby area. My room was very clean and comfortable and the bathroom was great. Hotel is in a good location (with a Metro station across the street) and in close proximity to Rue des Martyrs. Great shopping and cute boutiques. Reminded me of SOHO in NYC. Wished I could have enjoyed a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shliben
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my daughter for 4 nights. Hotel was absolutely fine and easy to walk to from the Gare du Nord. We had a twin room on the 2nd floor - pretty large, and the bathroom was clean but small. The room overlooked the road which could be noisy. It also overlooked a really small park which gave a good atmosphere. Slight problem: the airconditioning didn't work for the first 2 days and the room was noisy with the windows open. We didn't eat breakfast there as there were so many good options nearby. The Metro is 50 metres away and the noise from it is not an issue. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “This place is perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Aaitch
Reviews.Content: This place is perfect for a break away in 'gay Paris!' I booked the trip through 'shortbreaks' as a surprise for my boyfriend's 30th birthday - I honestly couldn't have made a better choice for quality and value. We travelled on the EuroStar from Waterloo - the hotel is so easy to get to/from the Gare du Nord - about 15 minutes on the Metro. The hotel is in a great location - situated in the historic district between the Opera and Montmatre - walkable to/from the major sites (if you like to wander, like we do!) alternatively, jump on the tube - a stone's throw from the front door. The hotel is adorable - especially the breakfast room! Our room was beautiful, and contrary to other reviews, was a substantial size, complete with beams, skylights and a fantastic view across Paris! We had a very comfy double bed and a spotless bathroom with a shower and a bath. Although you will doubtlessly be spoilt for choice with the number of places to eat and drink as you wander around the capital, if you want to stay local, there are some lovely bars and cafes close by - turn right out of the front door and take your first right. I strongly recommend the Lorette Opera - you won't be dissapointed! Bon Voyage! x

Reviews.Title: “A pleasure to stay in”
Reviews.Author: CarolandMatt
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I found a wonderful website called Parisselection.fr and came across this hotel which was under 100 Euros a night. I'm not a fan of Best Western properties but the pictures and previous reviews on Trip Advisor made me decide to take a gamble which I'm delighted to say paid off! The hotel is a bit of a trek from CDG if you go by train (RER and 3 Metro changes) but I made it by myself with a suitcase as my fiance was already in Paris working. The hotel is literally one minute walk from St Georges Metro station and is in a very quiet location with a few brasseries and shops nearby. The public areas are lovely, a mix of very modern and traditional and simple but it's a shame there is no bar. There is a lovely little wine shop around 100m up the road on the right hand side so take a cork screw! On the plus side, the hotel is very quiet at night because of there being no bar full of people.
