You could hear the Metro under the hotel but it stops at around 1am and it was actually quite soothing to listen to. I'm a very light sleeper and it didn't bother me! The rooms are small with the creakiest floors ever but this just adds to the charm. We could just see the Eiffel Tower at night twinkling in the distance (room 406!) which was a real bonus. We found that buying Metro tickets in books of 10 for 10.90 was the best way to travel as you can use the same ticket as many times as you like for 2 hours. One book lasted us most of the weekend. Head up on foot to the Pigalle at night and go into Chao Bar for some great cocktails and comfy seats. I just wish the no-smoking ban had reached Paris as we smelled like ashtrays by the time we left! I would definitely recommend this hotel, it's a bit out the way but it means you tend to explore areas you wouldn't normally and it was cheaper and quiet. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “warm & lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: amirim
Reviews.Content: first of all we want to say a big thank you to the tripadvisor members who recommended this hotel!. the hotel is modernly designed & it has a wellcoming atmosphere. the room was really small!! (really really small) but very clean and nice. breakfast was (included in our deal) good- coffee, tea, eggs,cereals, honey etc & off course croassons& baggets!. the staff was polite and helpful. location- about 15 minutes walk from the opera. just a few meters to the nearest metro station. lots of restaurants & all kind of (great) food stors in the area - boulongeries, pattisseries delicatessen etc the only disadvantage is the line of the metro that runs in the station near the hotel - because of its rut you have to change lines all the time to get to places of interest. altogether this is a good hotel and a great value for its price. from: amir family- israel

Reviews.Title: “perfect stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Ralu&Dani
Reviews.Content: we stay in this hotel for 6 days on holliday. it was perfect for paris regarding the price, location. helpfull staf, very clean. next time i will go there for sure

Reviews.Title: “GEM - great location, clean and inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: Single_in_MTL
Reviews.Content: steps away from the metro, monmartre and sacre-coeur. also, moulin rouge is a couple blocks away. very clean, quiet and convenient. the mattress was a little rough but we were so tired from all the sightseeing we just passed out. great resto to try: go to bastille a place called café de l'industrie

Reviews.Title: “Don t Go There”
Reviews.Author: Shine66
Reviews.Content: I booked a room 15 Days ago and when i arrived, they told me that they had a reservation problem on computer, so they will give me a taxi for another room in St Lazare...CHARMING ! ! Take care, apparently, they used to practice Surbooking and when you arrive they put you in partner hotel in a horrible room and in a bad place. In a word don t go there !! ps : Furthermore, i confirmed ex critizes that the hotel is very noizy with the subway...

Reviews.Title: “good area”
Reviews.Author: sallcall
Reviews.Content: Nice pleasant hotel, very quiet. Lovely dining room. No bar.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Paris”
Reviews.Author: KSI
Reviews.Content: Just as all the others have previous said....GREAT VALUE for Paris at $120 EURO / night. GREAT location, 2 minute walk to Metro, 5 minute walk to Sacré-Coeur, 10 minute walk to Galeries Layfayette & Printemps and fabulous shopping. Good Staff. Clean Hotel. Great Modern Design. The downside was (you guessed it) our room was the size of a shoebox. The first night we were in room #4 on the first floor, just across from the lobby. it had to be the smallest hotel room I have ever been in, I have had bathrooms bigger than this room. The noise was terrible, we could hear the Metro all night, and noise from both the lobby and restaurant in the morning. We requested a new room the next day, and they moved us on the 2nd night, for our remaining 3 nights, to the 4th floor, and we thoroughly enjoyed the balance of our stay. When travelling to Paris again on business travel, I would not stay here, I would seek a larger room, with more space conducive to working. However, I will definately stay here again when in Paris on personal travel, because how much time do you really spend in your room in the greatest city in Europe? PS-The gentlemen at the front desk gave us a great recommendation for a restaurant 'La Juliette'. Good value, great French cuisine.

Reviews.Title: “If your budget is EUR100 per night, it is the one !”
Reviews.Author: MacMini
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 3 night starting from 14 Sept 06. Here are my comments in short: Location - 1 minute walk from Saint Geroge Metro station, which is 3 or 4 stops from the main tourist spots, what else can you ask for ? Receptionists - helpful but not cheerful, they are too busy all the times but are willing to help The room : - the room is small but remember you are not in Thailand - the blankets, the sheet and the pillows are not very clean but bearable - the bathroom is what I like the most, bright, clean, fresh feeling - quite (air conditioning is on and the window is shut), you'd better check when they will turn the air conditioning off when you book in Winter Surrounding area - there is a lot of coffee shops and bars around but they are decent ones, so they are not noisy. There is a supermarket right down the street. But they do not provide slippers. You have to bring your own ! Recommended !

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sticks77
Reviews.Content: Suprisingly modern & clean hotel. Small rooms but that was expected in Paris. Staff at front desk very helpful. Convenient location with metro stop less than 5 min walk

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rosie_ict
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Lorette Opera hotel for 3 nights from the 11th August. During our stay we had non-stop rain, but thankfully we had the lovely hotel to return to. The rooms were clean and plenty big enough for our needs. The bathroom was also extremely clean and the shower was lovely and powerful. The location was excellent, metro stop literally just down the road and in walking distance of the Sacre Coure. We even walked to the Louve, quite a way but fine if you don't mind walking. Didn't have breakfast at the hotel, as 11 euros seemed quite expensive, plus there is a lovely patisserie just round the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: GeneL
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights end of October 2005, friday night and saturday night. Two persons, in our early 30's. Front desk: daytime staff english wasn't very good, but enough to get the job done. Evening staff, helpful man. I asked for electrical adapter and water kettle which he was able to provide. Left my bags with the desk on check out day to do some last minute sight seeing and had no problems retrieving luggage. Room: just enough room for two people. No complaints with bed or bath. Bathroom had good water pressure and hot water. Clean. Read reviews that there maybe noise problems and was true for one night. I believe there's a pub nearby downstairs and there was some argument outside which woke us up. Amenities: no vending machines, so you need to purchase from local grocery stores nearby, not expensive. They don't stay open very late, so best to buy early. No fridge in room, and I didn't check to see if there was an ice machine. Underground station nearby. Closest one is on green line and not pink line to Le Louvre. Need to casually walk ~8 mins to that one. Overall - I paid 100 euros per night, which I think was a bit pricey. I figure 75 - 80 euros was more like it. Did not tip anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Charmant!”
Reviews.Author: Fifi&Tex
Reviews.Content: Dates: July 4-6, 2006 This freshly renovated hotel is in the 9e arrondissement, putting it in a not-too-touristy neighborhood relatively close to both Montmartre and big shopping at Printemps and the Galeries Lafayette. It's near the slightly seamy Pigalle area,too. And there's a story to tell: We booked this hotel near the end of our stay in France because it offered air-conditioned rooms, something we had not had anywhere during the trip. It was a bad sign when we arrived to find that our room was only big enough for a bed and one suitcase AND that there was an enormous fan standing under the one air-conditioning unit.. (bad sign.) A very Parisian and unhelpful desk clerk assured us that 1. we did not know how to work the air conditioner. then that 2. a technician would fix the slight problem in the morning and finally that 3. all a/c in the hotel had been turned off because of the big problem. All of that was fiction. After much heated discussion en francais, the clerk agreed to give us free continental breakfasts for two mornings, but fixing the a/c problem was "impossible." the next morning a more helpful clerk changed our room to a higher floor with space for two suitcases and (ah yes!) A/C. We would recommend this hotel because the price is extremely reasonable, the decor is a delightful combo of modern and "ancien," and the location is right near a Metro stop. And that stern unhelpful desk clerk? We figure that he was only part of the Paris milieu.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: mametspeak
Reviews.Content: Best Western Lorette Opera is located in a charming neighborhood, midway between the Paris Opera and Montmarte. Our updated room with twin beds was of adequate size. The rooms at the top are best since you won't feel the metro that rumbles beneath the hotel. The non-smoking rooms are on the bottom floors. That's where I stayed and they were generally quiet. The staff was good and helpful. There are several markets and bakeries near the hotel. You can buy breakfast (crossiants, cheese, orange juice etc.) and eat in your room or elsewhere. There is also a wonderful outdoor restauraunt around the corner from the hotel. The St. Georges metro is conveniently located across the street. I felt completely at ease at the hotel (though the notorious "Pigalle" district is not too far). Within walking distance from the Lorette Opera is Sacre Coeur, Montmarte, Paris Opera and the Louvre.

Reviews.Title: “Just right!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I went to Paris with my girlfriens who has always wanted to go, and we were very happy with the hotel. It was very clean, a good location and right next to a Metro stop, so it was easy access to the Metro links. The room was quite small, but very clean, the bathroom was first class, very hot powerful shower, which is exactly what you need after walking the majority of the day. It is not in a loud location so getting to sleep was not a problem. Would definetley stay there again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, would definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Ace3kiwi
Reviews.Content: During our recent trip to France we stayed in this Paris hotel on two occasions. Everyone tells you the rooms are small and they are but we managed to put suitcases under the desk and used the wardrobe so it wasn't too difficult. The location, being so close to the St George metro station, was wonderful and we loved the public areas of the hotel - very chic decor.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and clean. Good location”
Reviews.Author: lau_spr
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 3 nights with my boyfriend in December and we were completely satisfied. Spacious and clean non-smoking twin room (though I saw very small double rooms on the same floor). Modern and comfortable, with a very big desk, one chair and an armchair. Also very comfortable beds. Fully corrsponding to pictures on the web. Also very near to metro station and Montmartre for a walk. Really nice and would stay there again for short trips.

Reviews.Title: “All most Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very nice, modern and affordable Hotel. Generally cannot fault this hotel, it had everything you could ask for, maybe the only thing missing in the Hotel is a bar. The room was a little small but extremely clean and tidy, and almost brand new, a pleasure to come back to. The staff were helpful and friendly. The location of the hotel was great, the metro is only 20 meters away, and you can walk to the ‘Moulin Rouge’, ‘Boulevard de Clichy’, in under 10 Mins. I would defiantly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: WantToSeeItAll
Reviews.Content: I would actually give this hotel 3+ stars. First the good- it's clean, and decent. Air conditioner works well, and towels are good. No face cloths. Good hair dryer. The furniture is made of orange plastic, the chairs and bed. Curtains nice. Shower has no curtain and makes a mess all over the floor. In a okay to good neighborhood, a little far for the major sights, but close to the metro stop, a 1/2 block away. Not in walking distance from Moulin Rouge and Montmartre, we walked it and it was at least 2-3 miles to and fro. Restarants around area just fair. The bad- which was tolerable I guess. The rooms are SMALL, the beds are not full size twin but a 3/4 twin, pushed together, and they are so hard you wake up aching and hurt when you turn. The noise is almost unbearable, if you sleep with windows open you will not sleep. We awoke to sounds of trash truck every morning breaking glass, etc. dumping a very large dumpster, a trumpet playing a wake up call one morning, a jack hammer fixing a hole in the street, and various other early morning noises. We went to sleep each night with the rumble of the metro under the street and this goes on all night and we were on the second floor. Horns beeping, ppl yelling, but they do settle down especially if you have a pillow on your head. Concierge not too knowledgable but kind. Arranged a shuttle to airport at a fraction of cost of taxi, or so they said. Breakfast cold rolls, and hot water for tea/coffee. No coffee maker in room, or tea, will give you one for one night if you request it. In UK there is a nice tea service and goodies in every room. Missed that. The only way I would stay here again is if I got a bargain price, would rather stay in Rue Cler, or Latin Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “well worth considering”
Reviews.Author: CW88
Reviews.Content: Having recently returned from our second stay at the Lorette Opera we would certainly recommend it as a clean and good value option. All of the hotel staff were very friendly & efficient. We would suggest taking advantage of the good value breakfast deals offered in many cafes & bars rather than the quite limited breakfast in the hotel. The excellent public transport system in Paris means that it is easy to get out and about from the hotel. The metro and bus stops are very close by and both systems are very easy to navigate.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is okey.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotels interior is nice and has a modern touch with preserved old details. But our room was really small but clean and (as always) it looked better in picture. The location was pretty fine just a couple of blocks from the Moulin Rouge and Pigalle. Simply a cute neughborhood. And near to St. Georges metro station. The staff were nice and polite but not over the top. Price vs. value: hmmm I would say a little bit over average.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not that great either!”
Reviews.Author: efc
Reviews.Content: At first my wife and I were given a very small room - so small that we could not even open our luggage! We've decided to ask for a bigger room and thought that if the staff won't give us one, we'll just have to cancel our reservation and go to another hotel instead. Luckily, there was a bigger room available. And we were allowed to change rooms without any problem or additional charges. No frills standard 3-star room - double bed, tv, small table, however there was no fridge. Broadband internet access was available but very expensive (29 euros per day)!

Reviews.Title: “Small but perfectly formed!”
Reviews.Author: Londongirl5
Reviews.Content: After looking extensively at the reviews on this site, we settled on the Lorette Opera for our 3 night stay in Paris, and once again, Trip Advisor served us well! The hotel has been recently refurbished, and the communal areas are lovely - very stylish. It does look just like the pictures! Yes, the room was tiny - the double bed took up most of the floor space - but it was very clean and the furnishings were new. The bathroom was pretty small - there was a small bathtub with an excellent shower over it - but again new and spotlessly clean. If - like us - you'd prefer a small but modern room to a larger but dated one, then this is the choice for you. The heating was on in the hotel when we were there. Yes, the room was very warm, but this was quite welcome given how cold it was outside! There is also an opening window - ours overlooked a pretty courtyard - if you need to cool the room down a bit. I did notice a slight rumbling noise from time to time, which I’d guess was from the Metro, but it didn’t bother me too much, and in any case I don’t think the Metro runs into the night. I wouldn’t say the staff were particularly friendly, but they seemed helpful enough. Breakfast in the hotel is a bit steep at 11 euros each for coffee, croissants, bread and yoghurt, but worth a try one day just to check out the breakfast room! The location was also pretty good - within walking distance of Sacre Coeur (although up a pretty steep hill), the Opera and the big department stores - and possibly also other sites, but with a Metro stop literally opposite the hotel, and French taxis being relatively cheap, we didn’t try this out. The only downside is that there's not that much in the way of restaurants and bars in the immediate vicinity of the hotel. It's a shame there wasn't a bar in the hotel because it would have been lovely to relax in the stylish surroundings. All in all, this hotel served us well, and we would probably go back if we return to Paris. I would probably prefer to stay a little more central - nearer the Seine and the Louvre - or perhaps in the Latin Quarter - but no doubt we’d end up paying considerably more for a hotel that wasn't so nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good area”
Reviews.Author: Karen/KLondon
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the price. Area excellent, tube stop (Saint George) outside. Stylish public areas. Our group had two rooms. One was fine one was far too small. Ask for a room on the front of the hotel is you want a little more space.

Reviews.Title: “This was a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent a romantic week in Paris, and we got home just a few days ago, so I'm writing this while its fresh in my mind. I think of myself as something of a veteran of Paris so the things that might bother others I guess I might be used to. The last reviewer comlpained about the A/C being turned off, and it was, so when it got stuffy we just opened the window. This is no big deal. Ok, for the review: Overall, this was a very nice hotel. Its very close to a metro stop, which is very convenient. Its also in a nice area. On the first day there we walked to Sacre Coeur, which took a leisurely 15 or 20 minutes. On several other days we walked to either the Gare du Nord and St. Lazarre, as the hotel is situated roughly right between them. The hotel staff was also professional and helpful, and they answered questions whenever I wanted to know something. The hotel also had all the modern things I needed... in spite of my promise to myself that I would not check email while I was on vacation I did it anyway, and they had a nice computer downstairs set up with a little terminal to swipe your credit card. They also had TV in the room with CNN and BBC in English - much to my dismay they also had Al Jazeera, but then it is France. The hotel property is nice, well decorated, and even charming. There is a neat little courtyard at the ground level. The breakfast area is also very nice, with stone walls and roof. Very European. We didn't eat breakfast there because they wanted 14 euros each for it, and it was much cheaper in the nice little cafe right outside the hotel. The room was small, but there was ample space in the closet for all of our things, and also for our empty suitcases. The bathroom was nice and clean, and the shower was actually quite nice. Good hot water, very good water pressure, and good shower fixtures. I don't have much criticism, really, but here's all that I can think of: some have noted before, the shower in the room leaked water onto the floor, but it wasn't terrible and the hotel provided three smaller sized towels each day to put outside the shower (in addition to the large towels for us). It worked fine. The bed was probably a little too firm for our liking, especially after long days on our feet - but that's not much of a complaint, really. The last thing is that the Pigalle district is not that far away. You'd never know it unless you went looking for it because there are no real tourist landmarks there except the Moulin Rouge - but if you go there then you're going for the specific reason of seeing that area. My girlfriend and I went to see the Moulin Rouge the night before we came home and we were prefectly safe at 10pm walking down the crowded streets full of other tourists doing exactly what we were doing. I can understand that some people might decide due to jet lag, or the stress of traveling long distances that they did not enjoy their trip to Paris. I'm convinced, however, that the only reason you would be disappointed in this hotel is if you just decided you didn't like Paris.

Reviews.Title: “'What can I do?! You tell me what to do.' the Receptionist Yves said”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked thru Expedia and double-checked a few times that this hotel has air-conditioning. Upon arrival, we found that the air-condition is turned off. My girlfriend called the reception and was told that it is winter time and we didn't need air-conditioning. I went down to the reception and the receptionist called Yves told me that when weather turn cold, people come turned off the air-condition and installed the heaters. And then he raised his voices 'What can I do?! You tell me what to do.' If I haven't paid in advance, we would have checked out immediately. The last thing you want when you traveling, in particularly with your girlfriend, is to have bad bad bad customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: rose5
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a long weekend in Paris and stayed in this hotel with my fiance. We were very pleased with the hotel, it is in a great location beside a metro station(St. George) and within walking distance of one of the main shopping areas (Blvd. Haussman). The hotel is extremely clean and our room and ensuite bathroom was spotless if not a bit on the small side. We stayed in a room with a double bed which took up most of the floor space but this didn't matter as we spent so little time there. Going by the website pictures, the twin bed rooms may be larger. The room was very warm during the night despite a full air conditioning system on the wall which didn't seem to be turned on at this time of year. (It was unusually warm for October in Paris at the weekend: 25 degrees C!) The reception staff in the hotel were friendly and helpful and spoke English if required to do so without hesitation or annoyance. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone who is looking for a small, clean, friendlyand easily accessible base in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: was worried about the location as someone said the pigalle area nearby was dodgy.but the hotel is far enough away and pigalle wasnt as bad as i thought.the hotel looks brand new as its been refurbished recently.10 out of 10 for cleanliness of rooms and hotel.stayed in room 504 for 3 nights for £210.the room was small and as someone mentioned there is a park nearby but it is full of toddlers and not teenagers it seems to be a creche of some sort.location is right next to st.george metro which is on line 12.if your from the uk and end up at port malliot coach park .the metro is hidden from view and not that easy to find.so we got a taxi from the concorde hotel for 12euros and was like a thrill ride in itself.lost count of the near crashes.st george metro is a great location for exploring paris just a few stops along and you can finde concorde here you can find a park ,a view of the tower,or can stroll up the champs elysees best near sunset.only minor problem was our rooms were on the warm side 25 degrees celcius.air con was available.in summary would stay here again as area is safe.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique feel in a cool area”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: An excellent find in a superb location. Only 10 minutes walk to Pigalle, the Opera House and Galeries Lafayette, and within walking distance of the Louvre, Montmarte, Notre Dame. Only warning is that on a Sunday morning there are few cafes open, so recommend you take the breakfast option at 11 euro.

Reviews.Title: “Funky great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: rag_gars
Reviews.Content: Four of us (2 couples) stayed here for 4 nights and it really is as good as the photos look. Perfect location - a two minute walk form the nearest underground station. Great little bohemian restaurants a few streets away. Near enough to Pigalle that you can walk there to see the "sights" and Moulin Rouge, but far enough away that you are not staying in the red light district. Perfect ! So much so that we shall be returning in another few days time. Great little cafe right across the street that serves the greatest coffee. Staff were so nice too and rooms were spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique style hotel”
Reviews.Author: NinaLouise
Reviews.Content: I was very pleasantly surprised with this boutique style hotel. With a mix of antique furniture and modern lighting it was the perfect place to stay. Clean and spacious with a massive bathroom. I can highly recommend room Number 5 which is ground floor with big doors that open onto a cute courtyard in the middle of the hotel. You would never think that this was part of a Best Western chain and I am sure that most people who stay here will be impressed! The location is approx five mins from the Opera district by foot. You can hear the metro rumbling below but I only knew this as i had read a previous review on this site before I left. But it is definately not that noticable!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice!”
Reviews.Author: janle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the BW Lorette Opera for a week (20.08 - 27.08), and I found it to be a great hotel. The location is just 10 minutes by foot from the Opera district, and 5 minutes walk from the Pigalle area where Moulin Rouge is located. (The Pigalle area is not my favourite area in Paris, so that was a bit of a minus) The metro is not even a minutes walk from the hotel so that is a major plus. The rooms (at least the one I had) were very small, but definitely ok considering it's maine purpose. The cleaning was very good. After they had cleaned the room, there was always a very good, refreshing smell in the room which I appreciated. No minibar or tea/ coffee facilities in the room... The staff was extremely helpfull and service minded. The hotel provides a shuttle service to the airport, which is a cheap alternative for transportation to the airport on departure. Be sure to ask for it at the beginning of your stay. Definitely a good choice at a good price for your stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly Staff and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the BW Lorette Opera Hotel over the 19th August to the 22nd August. It was my first visit to Paris and was bowled over by this fantastic city. What made my visit even better was staying at a good quality hotel. It's location is good. From CDG Airport, the Roissybus Opera dropped us off adjacent to the oppulent Opera House. From there we took a cab to the Hotel. That cost us €10 but we could have easily taken the metro to Saint Georges station which is a stone throws away from the hotel. Whatever you do use the Metro. Its efficient and cheap but be warned changing lines can be frequent and to change means plenty of walking up and down stairs. A great way to digest your meal though. The hotel is in the St Georges area and it seemed that the locals think of the place as a mini village within the city. On Sunday morning, they all come out with the roads behind Rue Notre Dame de la Lorette closed to traffic. The shops are open and it has a real sense of community. Very Nice indeed especially the deli which has a great selection of cheeses. There is a good wine shop too. I can't tell you the name of the road I'm afraid but its directly behind the Hotel. Inside, its decorated in white with wood flooring and with sparkling lighting. The room I had was clean, with an excellent bathroom - and yes the shower was great. The staff were friendly and courteous. All in all a very nice stay and I would definately use it again. Mario 26.08.05

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location at reasonable price - go there!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is newly renovated in a modern style with respect payed to the old building - very tastefully done. The room we stayed in was pretty small but definetely big enough for the relatively short periods of time we spent there - Sleeping, changing clothes etc. The staff was most kind at every encounter. Important tip -! book over the internet - we payed 85 euros a night, instead of the app. 110 euros if booked on the spot , all because we booked over the net! Highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “nice medium size hotel”
Reviews.Author: gogocat
Reviews.Content: well located next to the metro station. Recently renovated and refurbished. Room is clean and above average size. Spark clean bath room with good tub and washing basin. Airconditioned and multi TV channels a/v Staff are helpful but there is a lack of free internet connection which u are expected to pay 6 Euro per 5 mins. In general, a bargain hotel
